knowledge_articles.title: How to Connect to the Corporate VPN
knowledge_articles.body:
Prerequisites

Before connecting, ensure you have the GlobalProtect VPN client installed on your device and that your account has been provisioned for remote access by IT.

Connection Steps

  1. Open the GlobalProtect application from your system tray or Applications folder.
  2. Enter the portal address: vpn.company.com
  3. Authenticate using your corporate credentials and approve the MFA prompt on your mobile device.
  4. Wait for the status to show Connected before accessing internal resources.

Troubleshooting

If the connection fails, check that you are not on a restricted network. Try switching from WiFi to a mobile hotspot. If the issue persists, restart the VPN client and retry. Contact the Service Desk if problems continue.

knowledge_articles.title: Setting Up Outlook on a New Device
knowledge_articles.body:
Automatic Setup (Recommended)

Outlook supports Autodiscover for company email. Open Outlook, enter your corporate email address, and click Connect. Outlook will automatically detect the Exchange server settings and configure your mailbox.

Manual Setup

  1. Open Outlook and go to File > Add Account.
  2. Select Manual setup and choose Exchange or Microsoft 365.
  3. Enter the server address: mail.company.com
  4. Enter your full email address and password, then click Next.

Post-Setup

Once connected, allow up to 15 minutes for your mailbox to fully synchronise. Shared calendars and distribution lists will appear automatically after the initial sync completes.

knowledge_articles.title: Password Reset Procedure
knowledge_articles.body:
Self-Service Password Reset

You can reset your password at any time using the self-service portal at reset.company.com. You will need access to your registered mobile phone for verification.

  1. Navigate to reset.company.com and click Forgot Password.
  2. Enter your username and verify your identity via SMS or authenticator app.
  3. Create a new password that meets the complexity requirements: minimum 12 characters, including uppercase, lowercase, a number, and a special character.

When to Contact IT

If your account is locked out after multiple failed attempts, or if you no longer have access to your MFA device, contact the Service Desk directly. A technician will verify your identity before performing a manual reset.

knowledge_articles.title: Network Printer Setup Guide
knowledge_articles.body:
Finding Your Floor Printer

Each floor has a designated network printer. Refer to the printer map on the intranet to find the printer name and IP address for your floor.

Installation Steps

  1. Open Settings > Printers & Scanners and click Add a printer.
  2. Select Add a printer using a TCP/IP address and enter the printer IP from the floor map.
  3. Windows will automatically detect the printer model and install the correct driver.
  4. Print a test page to confirm the setup is working correctly.

Driver Issues

If the driver does not install automatically, download the latest driver from the manufacturer website or contact the Service Desk to have it pushed to your device via software deployment.

knowledge_articles.title: New Starter IT Onboarding Checklist
knowledge_articles.body:
IT Onboarding Checklist

Complete the following items during your first week to ensure you have full access to all company systems and resources.

  1. Laptop Setup - Collect your laptop from IT and sign in with your new credentials.
  2. Email Configuration - Set up Outlook using the company email setup guide.
  3. VPN Access - Install GlobalProtect and test your VPN connection for remote work.
  4. Security Training - Complete the mandatory cybersecurity awareness module on the learning portal.
  5. Badge Access - Visit reception to activate your building access badge.

If you encounter any issues during onboarding, raise a ticket with the Service Desk or speak to your line manager for assistance.
